description: Sicilians are a defensive civilization that excels in protecting their base and taking out enemy buildings with their unique unit, the Serjeant.
dark_age: Start with 6 villagers and a scout.
Build a house, a mill, and a lumber camp near forests.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Have around 22-24 population by the end of the Dark Age.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 11-12 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
feudal_age: Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade units and sell excess resources for gold.
Train archers and research Fletching upgrade.
Build a barracks and train militia.
Advance to Castle Age at around 19-21 minutes with 1000 food and 500 gold.
Have around 1200-1500 food, 400-500 wood, and 300-400 gold at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 10-12 villagers to food, 4-5 to wood, and 2-3 to gold.
castle_age: Build a second and third town center to expand your economy.
Train knights and research Bloodlines and Husbandry upgrades.
Build a siege workshop and train battering rams to take down enemy buildings.
Research Serjeant unique unit at the castle.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 30-32 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and all castle technologies.
Have around 3000-4000 food, 1500-2000 wood, and 1500-2000 gold at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 30-35 villagers to food, 15-20 to wood, and 12-15 to gold.
imperial_age: Train Serjeants and research Elite Serjeant upgrade.
Use Serjeants to take down enemy buildings and defend your base.
Have around 5000-6000 food, 3000-4000 wood, and 3000-4000 gold in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 50-60 villagers to food, 25-30 to wood, and 16-20 to gold.
